result.execSummary:
The defendant Aundray M Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

miscConds.notes: PAY restitution in the amount of $1,050.00 payable to the victim, Randall M. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Straight time.  Court ordered "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" towards the condition time.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (30 pages) commencing JULY 15, 2015, received and filed.  jm
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; filed.

Defendant Aundray M Evans in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Aundray M Evans in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State and defense. Additional statements made by defendant's grandmother, Deborah W.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for a period of 3 years under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 10 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Correction - straight time.  Court ordered "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" towards the condition time.
* No contact with the victim.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,050.00 payable to the victim, Randall M. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Crime Victim Impact Statement with attached Restitution Worksheet.

Defendant Aundray M Evans in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Aundray M Evans in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Aundray M Evans not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-15-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Scheduling conference on June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm., Br. 2 - Judge Donald.  Notice to parties sent.
Per Local Rule 4.20(c), this case should be assigned to General Felony.  Case re-tabbed to original assignment of Judge Donald, Br. 2.

Defendant Aundray M Evans in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Aundray M Evans in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is reassigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07 per request of Assistant District Attorney regarding the charges.  Case assignnment may be reviewed.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Randall M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Aundray M Evans in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Aundray M Evans in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Defendant Aundray M Evans not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 5-18-2015. Defendant is in custody at Lincoln Hills. Needs to be produced for court. Both files sent to case prep for OTP by Sheriff's department.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on  5-18-2015 at 1:30pm
